availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Meade Circuit Sct
7th April 1862

"It appearing to the satisfaction of the Court that James F Overton a Justice of the Peace of this County who formerally resided in the Garnettsville District being District No 5. has vacated his office, by raising an armed force of Calvery and joining the Army of the Southern Confederacy some months since, and where he remained until taken prisoner at the Battle and Surrender of Fort Donoldson,
Therefore the Court recommends to his Excillency B McGoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Dr Henry C Crist as a suitable person to be Commissioned to fill said vacancy"

A Copy
Att Wm Fairleigh Clk
Meade County Court

Dr. Henry C. Crist
Recommended as Justice of The Peace for Meade County
District No. 5.
Issd. Apr 24. 1862
